plant_translocations.content: uptake of isouron by sugarcane plants from soil was more rapid during the first 7 weeks than during the later stage. Specific activity in plants reached a maximum in 4-7 weeks. More than 83% of the radioactivity translocated to leaves after 2 weeks. Larger amount of radioactivity was detected in the young leaves at the earlier stage, but most of the activity was found in the old leaves at the late stage after 7 weeks. Up to 7 weeks, 97.7 to 94.4% of the radioactivities were extractable with methanol-water (2:1) from the leaves. Among them, dichloromethane extractable parts decreased from 73.4 to 26.3%, while water soluble fractions increased from 24.6 to 69.4% as the time elapsed. Since 5.4 to 17.7% of the radio_x0002_activities in the aqueous phase were extractable with dichloromethane after acid hydrolysis, the existence of metabolites in conjugated form was suggested.
plant_translocations.reference: 陳玉麟, 呉天基, 葉鴻展, & 王一雄. (1983). Uptake and Translocation of Isouron in Sugarcane Plants. Journal of Pesticide Science, 8(4), 607-611.

method.Plant Grown Condition: Sandy loam soil with clay 6%, silt 28%, sand 66%, organic matter 1.18%, pH 6.5 (H2O)
method.Chemical preparation: Pure isouron and 14C-isouron labeled at position 5 of the isoxazole ring with a specific activity of 8.28 mCi/mmol were provided. The soil was treated with 4 mg cold isouron amended with 1 μCi hot material per kg air-dried soil (equivalent to 1 kg a.i./ha) at 1 cm thickness.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: The soil surface was covered with soil treated with 4 mg of cold Isouron, amended with 1 μCi of hot material per kg of air-dried soil (equivalent to 1 kg a.i./ha, the recommended rate used in sugarcane fields) at a thickness of 1 cm.
method.Other Information: Four flats by planting 4 rows of 6 plants in each flat were cultivated in the experiment.
